AnLinux
is a open source project intent to bring the access of Linux to Android platform.

The icon of this application is taken from https://www.iconfinder.com , which is created by user : "Alpár-Etele Méder", you can reach the icon author by clicking "ICON AUTHOR" button below.

If you are looking for the source code used in this app, click the SOURCE CODE button.

If you are looking for scripts and rootfs used in this app, please click the CONTENT SOURCE button, they are license under GPLv2.

Thanks for using this apps.


Regards, EXA Lab
Icon Author
Source Code
Content Source
Choose
Copy
Launch
Ubuntu (Recommended for Beginner)
Xfce4 (Recommended)

First of all, thanks for downloading AnLinux, below are some important parts, please read carefully.

1. To keep the distro small and light weight for easy install, most distro except Arch Linux and Kali Nethunter are minimal rootfs, which means most package are not installed yet, you could install them according to your need, and stop asking if the distro is faked.

2. All distro are installed in this directory: /data/data/com.termux/files/home , please make sure that you have enough space before installing package and don't blame the app for occupying your device space because you are the one controlling it.

3. Some distro may not available due to your device architecture.

4. Currently, all device except mips based will work, if you encountered any error such as Proot signal 6, or function not implemented, just go to the Patches feature in app and apply SECCOMP patch.

5. NEVER install two Desktop Environment or Desktop Environment alongside Window Manager on a same distro, if you want to install another Desktop Environment or Window Manager, please reinstall the distro first. To do this, use "Uninstall" feature first, then reinstall it from Dashboard.


Thanks for reading, have a nice day :)
I Understand

WARNING: You should have wget installed on linux distro before proceeding, also remember only run this command inside the Linux System and not in Termux, otherwise it will not work!!!

About Ashmem: System V shared memory emulation on Android, using ashmem. That includes shmget, shmat, shmdt and shmctl functions. It does not use Binder service, and does not link to Java libraries. It uses Linux sendmsg/recvmsg API instead to transfer file handlers.

What it do: If you have error running some GUI programs, install this patch may solve the problem.

How to use: env LD_PRELOAD="/usr/local/lib/libandroid-shmem.so" linux_command"
Step 2 : Copy the command to clipboard : %1$s \n\nThis should install %2$s on your system.
Step 3 : Start Termux, paste and enter the command to install Patches. Remember: you will need to run ./start-*.sh to run the Linux System before using this command.

After that, you will need to run: chmod 755 additional.sh && ./additional.sh to setup resolv.conf and pacman-key, otherwise network connection and pacman wont work!!! (First time only)

Remember: you will need to run ./start-arch.sh to run the command line, after that, you will also need to run ./additional.sh to setup resolv.conf and pacman-key, otherwise network connection and pacman wont work!!! (First time only)
Note: Please run this command inside Arch Linux shell to enable BlackArch Repository (Arch Linux need to be installed first).\n\nStep 2 : Copy the command to clipboard : %1$s

Step 3 : Start Termux, enter Arch Linux shell by running ./start-arch.sh, then paste and enter the command to install BlackArch Repo. Remember: you will need to run ./start-arch.sh to enter Arch Linux shell first before using the command above.

Arch Linux image is bigger than other distro (Around 400 MB), and may cost a lot of device space after decompressing. Having spare space over 1.5GB is highly recommended before installing.


Note:

1. Tar may produce an error while extracting the image such as: tar: Ignoring unknown extended header keyword 'SCHILY.fflags', it is not harmful, simply ignore it.

2. Arch Linux image is hosted on an external server, the link may broken in some special case, Please email the developers at exalabdevelopers@gmail.com if encountered this issue.

Woah, wait wait wait.

Sorry for the interrupt, here are some warning:

1. Kali Nethunter image itself is around 1GB, after decompressing, it will cost more space, it is advice to have 5GB free space before installing.

2. Decompressing the image require some time (Around 10 minutes.)

3. Desktop environment won't work, DO NOT use command for Kali in Nethunter.

4. Nethunter image has not been updated more than a year, some component is broken, if you want an up-to-date, personalized experience, choose normal Kali distro instead.
Run with Root Permission

Please scroll down to see all steps if your device screen is small.

Please note that running wrong command in Root mode could damage the whole Android OS!

First, this feature is for Root Users only, if you never heard of Root, Superuser, SU, SuperSU, Magisk, then you should not use this feature.

I understand that the purpose of most user use this app is to INSTALL LINUX DISTRO WITHOUT ROOT ACCESS.

But, If your device have root access, you still want to run it without root? To be clear, having root access could have lots of benefit, especially when running high permission software such as penetration testing tools.

For those don't know how to do it, Termux could run it root mode, simply start Termux, and type su command, but that won't work as running ./start-*.sh command after the su call will result in PRoot not found error.

But this word are not exist to tell you that, of course, we have a solution to RUN LINUX DISTRO WITH ROOT ACCESS, just follow the instruction below:
1. Press the button to copy the command: pkg install tsu -y && hash -r
Start Termux, paste and enter the command above, after that, you could simply run the tsu command, then run ./start-*.sh like usual.

Sorry for the bothering, but this is important, so please take a look as we show this one time only.

Running Linux as Root has lots of benefit, but also contain dangerous that could wipe out whole Android OS if you don't know how to use it.

Please beware of what you are doing, author are not responsible if you run some harmful command and bricked your device, also please make sure you should NEVER fire up the Root terminal and run some command like rm -rf /* for experimental purpose.

By proceeding, you agree to those terms.
I Agree
Command copied
Close
Please scroll down to see all steps if your device screen is small.\n\nWARNING: Only run this if you encountered error such as Proot signal 6, or function not implemented.
Step 2 : Copy the command to clipboard : echo "export PROOT_NO_SECCOMP=1" >> .bashrc && hash -r
Step 3 : Start Termux, paste and enter the command to install Patches. Remember: you will need this command directly inside Termux and not in the Linux distro, otherwise it will not work.
Download Rootfs (Offline use)

This feature is to download the rootfs(Or simply know as distro) for offline use only, if you want to install distro normally you should install it from "Dashboard", not here.

Some users would want to download rootfs for investigation or learning purpose, we created this feature so users could easily find the location to download.

Clicking the Button below would open a webpage on Github where rootfs are stored:
https://github.com/EXALAB/AnLinux-Resources/tree/master/Rootfs
without further notification.
View
Window Manager

Please scroll down to see all steps if your device screen is small.

Windows Manager is a GUI similar as Desktop Environment, but it is much smaller and lighter, if you prefer something more light weight and legacy feel, Window Manager is for your, otherwise use Desktop Environment instead.

Recommended having 1.5 GB spare before installing.

WARNING: Only run this command inside the Linux System and not in Termux, otherwise it will not work!!!

Heavy DE

Heavy Desktop Environment was a feature that let you install Desktop Environment that are very beautiful and popular among desktop Linux users. But they require lots of space, resource and ram to work.

So before installing, please make sure you have at lease:

5GB of space
4GB ram
